nodes.name: Definition of store
nodes.fol: (forall (a m) (if (and (agent a)(memory m a)) (forall (e c) (iff (store' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (inFocus c a)(changeTo' e1 e2) (inm' e2 c m)(gen e1 e)))))))
nodes.english: An agent stores a concept in memory when there is a change from a state in which the concept is in focus but not in memory to one in which it is in memory

nodes.name: Definition of retrieve
nodes.fol: (forall (a m) (if (and (agent a)(memory m a)) (forall (e c) (iff (retrieve' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (inm c m)(changeTo' e1 e2) (inFocus' e2 c a)(gen e1 e)))))))
nodes.english: To retrieve a concept from memory is to change from a state in which the concept is in memory and not in focus to one in which it is in focus

nodes.name: Store requires agency
nodes.fol: (forall (a c)(if (store a c)(agent a)))
nodes.english: Storing is an action by agents

nodes.name: Retrieve requires agency
nodes.fol: (forall (a c)(if (retrieve a c)(agent a)))
nodes.english: Retrieving is an action by agents

nodes.name: Memory entry requires storage
nodes.fol: (forall (e c m a) (if (and (inm' e c m)(memory m a)) (exists (e1)(and (store' e1 a c)(cause e1 e)))))
nodes.english: The only way for a concept to get into an agent's memory is for it to be stored

nodes.name: Memory concepts have accessibility
nodes.fol: (forall (m a c) (if (and (memory m a)(inm c m)) (exists (x) (accessibility x c m))))
nodes.english: Concepts in memory have an accessibility which is an element in a partial ordering

nodes.name: Accessibility requires memory
nodes.fol: (forall (x c m) (if (accessibility x c m) (exists (a) (memory m a))))
nodes.english: Accessibility is a function mapping a concept and an agent's memory into an element of a partial ordering

nodes.name: Accessibility is functional
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 c m) (if (and (accessibility x1 c m)(accessibility x2 c m)) (equal x1 x2)))
nodes.english: Accessibility is a functional relationship - one concept in one memory has exactly one accessibility value

nodes.name: Accessibilities are in accessibility scale
nodes.fol: (forall (x c m a) (if (and (accessibility x c m)(memory m a)) (exists (s) (and (scale s)(inScale x s) (accessibilityScale s a)))))
nodes.english: Accessibilities are partially ordered; they are elements in the agent's accessibility scale

nodes.name: Accessibility scale constraint
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (if (accessibilityScale s a) (and (agent a)(scale s))))
nodes.english: Accessibility scales belong to agents and are scales

nodes.name: Memory threshold existence
nodes.fol: (forall (m a s) (if (and (memory m a)(accessibilityScale s a)) (exists (x0) (and (memoryThreshold x0 a)(inScale x0 s)))))
nodes.english: For any given agent, there is an accessibility value below which concepts are not retrieved from memory - the memory threshold

nodes.name: Memory threshold definition
nodes.fol: (forall (m a s) (if (and (memory m a)(accessibilityScale s a)) (forall (x0) (iff (memoryThreshold x0 a) (forall (x1 c e e1) (if (and (accessibility x1 c m)(gts' e x1 x0 s) (retrieve' e1 a c)) (enable e e1)))))))
nodes.english: A concept's accessibility being above the memory threshold enables retrieval

nodes.name: Definition of accessible
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (accessible c a) (exists (m x1 s x0) (and (memory m a)(accessibility x1 c m) (accessibilityScale s a)(memoryThreshold x0 a) (lts x0 x1 s)))))
nodes.english: If a concept's accessibility is above the memory threshold, then it is accessible

nodes.name: Importance affects accessibility
nodes.fol: (forall (c1 c2 i1 i2 x1 x2 s1 s2 a) (if (and (importanceScale s1 a)(accessibilityScale s2 a) (importance i1 c1 a)(importance i2 c2 a) (accessibility x1 c1 a)(accessibility x2 c2 a) (lts i1 i2 s1)(etc)) (leqs x1 x2 s2)))
nodes.english: There is an at least defeasible monotonic relation between the importance of a concept and its accessibility

nodes.name: Definition of remind
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 c1 a c2) (iff (remind' e1 c1 a c2) (exists (e2 e3) (and (inFocus' e2 c1 a)(cause e2 e3)(retrieve' e3 a c2) (gen e3 e1)))))
nodes.english: One concept can remind an agent of another concept when the first concept being in focus causes the second to be remembered

nodes.name: Associated requires agent
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a) (if (associated x y a)(agent a)))
nodes.english: The relation associated requires an agent as third argument

nodes.name: Association symmetry
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a) (if (and (associated x y a)(etc))(associated y x a)))
nodes.english: The relation associated is defeasibly symmetric in x and y

nodes.name: Cause associates cause and effect
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and (cause' e1 e2 e3)(believe a e1)) (associated e2 e3 a)))
nodes.english: Causes and effects are associated if the agent believes the causal relation

nodes.name: Implication associates antecedent and consequent
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and (imply' e1 e2 e3)(believe a e1)) (associated e2 e3 a)))
nodes.english: Antecedents and consequents in implicative rules are associated if the agent believes the implication

nodes.name: Eventualities associate with arguments
nodes.fol: (forall (a e x e1) (if (and (believe a e1)(arg' e1 x e)) (associated e x a)))
nodes.english: Eventualities are associated with their arguments if the agent believes the argument relation

nodes.name: Focus raises accessibility of associated concepts
nodes.fol: (forall (c1 c2 a e e3) (if (and (associated c1 c2 a)(changeTo' e e3) (inFocus' e3 c1 a)) (exists (e0 e1 e2 x1 x2 s) (and (change' e0 e1 e2)(accessibility' e1 x1 c2 a) (accessibility' e2 x2 c2 a)(lts x1 x2 s) (accessibilityScale s a)(cause e e0)))))
nodes.english: A concept being in focus raises the accessibility of associated concepts

nodes.name: Definition of remember1
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember1 a c)(accessible a c)))
nodes.english: Remember1: the agent has the concept in memory and it is accessible, but not necessarily in focus

nodes.name: Definition of remember2
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember2 a c)(retrieve a c)))
nodes.english: Remember2: there has actually been a retrieval from memory

nodes.name: Definition of remember3
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember3 a c) (exists (e) (and (cause a e)(retrieve' e a c)))))
nodes.english: Remember3: the agent plays a causal role in the remembering

nodes.name: Definition of remember4
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember4 a c) (exists (e) (and (succeed a e)(retrieve' e a c)))))
nodes.english: Remember4: there is a distinct attempt to retrieve something from memory, and it succeeds

nodes.name: Remember2 implies remember1
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember2 a c)(remember1 a c)))
nodes.english: Each sense of remembering implies the previous

nodes.name: Remember3 implies remember2
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember3 a c)(remember2 a c)))
nodes.english: Each sense of remembering implies the previous

nodes.name: Remember4 implies remember3
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember4 a c)(remember3 a c)))
nodes.english: Each sense of remembering implies the previous

nodes.name: Remember1 implies remember
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember1 a c)(remember a c)))
nodes.english: All types of remembering are senses of remember

nodes.name: People can remember things
nodes.fol: (forall (a m c) (if (and (person a)(memory m a)(inm c m)(etc)) (exists (e s) (able a e s)(remember' e a c))))
nodes.english: Because people can cause concepts to be in focus and this may cause them to remember other concepts, people have an ability to remember things

nodes.name: Definition of forget1
nodes.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (forget1' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (changeFrom' e1 e2)(accessible' e2 c a) (gen e1 e)))))
nodes.english: To forget1 a concept is for the accessibility to change from being above the memory threshold to being below it

nodes.name: Forget1 negates remember1
nodes.fol: (forall (a c) (if (forget1 a c)(not (remember1 a c))))
nodes.english: If an agent forgets something in the forget1 sense, they do not remember it under any notion of remembering

nodes.name: Definition of forget2
nodes.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (forget2' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (retrieve' e1 a c)(goodFor e1 a)(not' e2 e1) (gen e2 e)))))
nodes.english: To forget2 is to not retrieve when such a retrieval would have been good for you in some way

nodes.name: Definition of forget3
nodes.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (forget3' e a c) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (cause' e1 a e2)(changeFrom' e2 e3) (inFocus' e3 c a)(gen e1 e)))))
nodes.english: To forget3 is when the agent intentionally ceases to have the concept in focus

nodes.name: Focus enables action
nodes.fol: (forall (a e t e1) (if (and (agentOf a e)(atTime e t)(inFocus' e1 e a)) (exists (e2) (and (atTime' e2 e1 t)(enable e2 e)))))
nodes.english: If an agent is to do an event at time t, then that event being in the agent's focus of attention at time t enables the event

nodes.name: Definition of rememberTo
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (rememberTo a e) (exists (e1 t e2 e3 e4) (and (atTime' e1 e t)(goal e1 a)(agentOf a e) (retrieve' e2 a e1)(cause e2 e3)(atTime' e3 e4 t) (inFocus' e4 e1 a)))))
nodes.english: An agent remembers to do something if that action was part of their plan and retrieving it causes them to have that goal in focus at the designated time

nodes.name: Definition of repressed
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (if (repressed c a) (exists (m) (and (memory m a)(inm c m)(not (accessible c a))))))
nodes.english: If a concept c is repressed for an agent a, then c is in a's memory but it is not accessible

nodes.name: Repressed concepts cause unhappiness
nodes.fol: (forall (a x) (if (and (repressed' e x a)(etc)) (exists (e0 e1 e2) (and (thinkOf' e1 a x)(unhappy' e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2) (cause e0 e)))))
nodes.english: If something is repressed, then it is probably because thinking about it causes one to be unhappy

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
